CatDescriptText: Mr. Sam Richie, 106 East Jefferson Street, North Side, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 26, 1957, pg. 4, with question: "Do you believe we should have a state law forbidding strikes of trolley cars, buses, and taxicabs?"  Answer reads: "I'm a worker at Duquesne Light Company and since the public depends on so much on us, we are not allowed to strike, but have to settle our differences by arbitration. There should be a similar law for trolleys, buses, and taxicab workers.  They are no better than I am.  People depend on those services just as much as they do on ours."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Sam Richie wearing moustache, hat, and plaid shirt, standing in front of yard with house and light colored building with one window
